conclusion: Determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell when formed into a closed loop with resistance R.
Find the point of intersection of the U-I characteristics of the photocell and the resistor.
Graph labeled a is the U-I characteristic of the silicon photocell.
Graph labeled b is the U-I characteristic of the resistor R.
Intersection point of the U-I characteristics occurs at I = 0.2 A and U = 2.5 V.
Use the formula U = E - Ir to determine the internal resistance r.
Voltage across the photocell is 2.5 V and current is 0.2 A at the intersection point.
Emf E of the cell is 3.6 V from the intercept of the U-I characteristic on the voltage axis.
Substitute U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A into the formula: 2.5 = 3.6 - 0.2r.
Solve for r: 0.2r = 1.1 implies r = 5.5 Ω.
Verify calculation: internal resistance r should be consistent with the slope of the U-I characteristic.
Slope of the U-I characteristic of the cell is -18 V/A.
Discrepancy in interpretation of the slope; correct approach is using intersection point.
Correct internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 5.5 Ω.
